result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Allen Black III

defendant.name: Black, John Allen, III
defendant.address: C/O MHOC, 8885 S 68th St., Franklin, WI 53132

records.addlTxt: Adjourned order to show cause hearing on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to use or possess any alcohol, drugs or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is to report and comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program, including sobriety testing in accordance with WCS program protocols.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

3:00 PM Defendant John Allen Black III appeared by video, in custody from Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for John Allen Black III. Prosecuting attorney Joseph Patrick Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called to address the warrants issued in all cases.
Defense requests warrants be quashed. 
Defense is looking for a global offer. 
Atty Jensen advises the court of the circumstances surrounding the Defendant's other pending cases. 
Court quashes the warrants and sets $100 cash bond with the same conditions on each case.
Defense requests that 21CF1153 be set for trial with the other cases tagging along. Court will issue a trial scheduling order.
Clerk to produce OTP for Defendant to arrive 11/15/22 and stay through the trial.
Bail/bond hearing on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
